intro: Lachenalia tricolor var. quadricolor, commonly known as the four-colored lachenalia, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a bulbous perennial plant characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of yellow, orange, red, and purple, arranged in a raceme. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, emerging from a basal rosette of fleshy, strap-shaped foliage. Lachenalia tricolor var. quadricolor is well-suited for rock gardens and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
